newsitem.title: USA: Reynolds, Kaiser scrap talks on one plant.
newsitem.headline: Reynolds, Kaiser scrap talks on one plant.

text.p: Reynolds Metals Co said Thursday it and Kaiser Aluminum Corp had halted talks over Kaiser's proposed purchase of one of two plants.
Reynolds said it was still going ahead with talks to sell Kaiser the other one, an extrusion plant in Bellwood, Va.
"The companies continue to anticipate closing (talks on the second plant) in the second quarter," it said.
A spokeswoman for Reynolds said the company was "assessing all available options" regarding the future of the first plant, which makes sheets and plates in McCook, Ill..
A Kaiser official said his company decided to withdraw its offer to buy the McCook plant because "we were unable to reach various matters regarding that transaction".
On April 3, Reynolds said it had received a letter of intent from Kaiser to buy the two plants.
The company, which did not disclose any terms surrounding the potential sale, said it wanted to get rid of the plants in order to streamline its business focus.
